title: New Aesthetics
subtitle: The new aesthetic emerges when new technologies allow physical design objects to become a neutral comfort substrate and culture migrates into ambient, individualized experiences.

prompt.context: A discussion on new aesthetics prompted by Patrick Collison, responded to by rina, then by tomismeta

themes.name: Ephemeral Aesthetics
themes.thesis: Internet visual aesthetics are largely ephemeral and niche with no clear dominant thematic characteristics. The impermanence of digital expression is a primary driver.

evidence.speaker: tom
evidence.quote: Today, internet visual aesthetics feel largely ephemeral and niche with no clear dominant thematic characteristics. The impermanence of digital expression could be a primary driver.

questions: Is the absence of a dominant aesthetic a temporary state or a permanent feature of digital culture?

themes.name: Observation Tooling Gap
themes.thesis: We lack the tools to observe the fluid and chaotic flow of aesthetics across physical, digital, and metaspatial experiences simultaneously. Building such a lens could itself be hyperstitional.

evidence.speaker: tom
evidence.quote: I believe we lack the 'tools' to observe such a fluid and chaotic flow of an aesthetic across metaspatial experiences simultaneously. A good use of some of the grant funds referenced would be build a lens to more acutely observe and chronicle aesthetic flow and evolution at scale (physical, digital and metaspatial), which could serve as a hyperstitional mechanic in itself.

questions: What would an aesthetic telemetry system look like?
How does observing aesthetic flow become hyperstitional?

themes.name: Aesthetic Thrashing & Nostalgia Bias
themes.thesis: We will continue cycling through nostalgic aesthetics (mid-century modern, farmhouse, etc.) as a way to defer cognitive load from the relentless chaos of options.

evidence.speaker: tom
evidence.quote: My sense is that we'll continue this 'aesthetic thrashing' with a bias towards anchoring on nostalgic aesthetics for modern design objects (mid-century modern, farmhouse, etc.) for the next few years which allows for the deferral of cognitive load from the substantial, relentless, stream of options and chaos we experience today.

evidence.speaker: bstrxn
evidence.quote: This puts into words something I've been feeling lately. Which is that our current obsession of cycling through all the nostalgic aesthetics of the past in fashion (80s-90s) and architecture (art deco & mid century) is like a collective unconscious goodbye before we take off and fragment taste & aesthetics leading to the need for a universal comfort substrate void of embellishments or extras unless curated.

questions: Is nostalgia a coping mechanism for aesthetic overload?
Are we saying goodbye to shared aesthetics?

themes.name: Technology as Catalyst
themes.thesis: Only major technology acceleration (BCI, robotics, ambient intelligence) will catalyze an inflection point for the emergence of an organic 'new aesthetic.'

evidence.speaker: tom
evidence.quote: My intuition is that only major technology acceleration will catalyze an inflection point for the emergence of an organic 'new aesthetic.'

questions: How long until this inflection point?

themes.name: Human vs. Utilitarian Spaces
themes.thesis: Physical design will bifurcate into human-centered spaces (comfort, connection, curation) and utilitarian spaces optimized for robot/automation efficiency. Like the car interior vs. the engine, or stage vs. backstage.

evidence.speaker: tom
evidence.quote: With the advent and broader acceptance and adoption of ambient intelligence (brain-computer interfaces) and robotics, we'll see a deepening separation in physical design aesthetic between human spaces (connect, comfort, curate) and utilitarian spaces designed for robot and automation efficiency and effectiveness (cooking, home maintenance, etc.). Picture the outside or interior of a car versus the engine, or the stage versus the backstage.

questions: What happens to spaces that are both human and utilitarian?
Does this separation already exist in nascent form?

themes.name: Neutral Comfort Substrate
themes.thesis: Human-centered spaces will become visually 'dull' but optimized for physical comfort and sense experience. They will serve as neutral canvases for individually curated digital aesthetic 'skins.'

evidence.speaker: tom
evidence.quote: The human-centered spaces will become more comfortable and physically sense-optimized, but visually aesthetically 'dull,' functioning as neutral observatories to the naked eye (and mind). This neutrality will allow them to serve as a canvas for individually curated, shareable, digital aesthetic 'skins,' streamed to each of us via brain-computer interfaces.

evidence.speaker: bstrxn
evidence.quote: Which makes Ye's droam concept make a lot more sense as an abstraction / comfort substrate

questions: What does a 'neutral' aesthetic look like?
How does Ye's droam concept prefigure this?

themes.name: BCI-Streamed Aesthetic Skins
themes.thesis: Aesthetics will be rendered individually via brain-computer interfaces—metaspatial, ambient, digitally malleable. We'll change them like songs to suit our mood.

evidence.speaker: tom
evidence.quote: The half-life of digitally and ambiently observed aesthetics will continue to accelerate, and we'll change them like songs to suit our mood.

evidence.speaker: tom
evidence.quote: A 'new aesthetic' will be rendered individually—metaspacial, ambiently experienced, and digitally malleable on a neutral, human-optimized, comfort substrate physical canvas. The emphasis of physical design objects will be on how they're felt or physically experienced, not seen.

questions: What is the social dimension of shareable skins?
Does this eliminate the need for physical aesthetic objects?

themes.name: Physical Convergence / Experiential Divergence
themes.thesis: Physical spaces converge toward hyper-abstraction (comfort substrate), while the way we experience them diverges individually.

evidence.speaker: tom
evidence.quote: Physical spaces will converge toward a hyper-abstraction of a comfort substrate, while the way we experience them continues to diverge—individually.

questions: Is this the end of shared aesthetic experience?
What holds society together if aesthetic experience is fully individualized?

theme_relationships.description: We can't identify dominant aesthetics partly because we lack tools to observe them at scale.
Ephemerality drives us to anchor on nostalgic aesthetics for stability.
We're stuck in thrashing until technology provides an escape route.
BCI and robotics enable the bifurcation of space types.
Human spaces become neutral substrates once utilitarian functions are separated out.
Neutral substrates serve as canvases for BCI-streamed aesthetic overlays.
BCI skins are the mechanism by which physical convergence enables experiential divergence.
Nostalgia cycling is an unconscious goodbye before fragmenting into individualized aesthetic substrates.

observations: Minimalist, neutral aesthetic as physical canvas

key_metaphors.meaning: Visible human experience vs. hidden functional infrastructure
Rapid, mood-based cycling through ambient aesthetic overlays
